title: 'Can't Babysit Anyone, Need To Get His Work Ethic Right': Shreyas Iyer's Brutal Reality-Check To Prithvi Sh - News18
summary:
'Can't Babysit Anyone, Need To Get His Work Ethic Right': Shreyas Iyer's Brutal Reality-Check To Prithvi Shaw

Date: December 16, 2024, Source: News18

Shreyas Iyer, Mumbai's skipper, has challenged Prithvi Shaw to improve his work ethics to unlock his vast potential. Iyer believes that Shaw's talent is unparalleled but insists that the drive to perform must come from within the player.

  • Shaw scored 197 runs in nine games but did not achieve a 50+ score.
  • Iyer emphasizes that talent alone is not enough without a strong work ethic.
  • The Mumbai skipper suggests that Shaw must take personal responsibility for his performance.
“He has to focus. He has to sit back and put a thinking cap on. He will get the answer by himself. No one can force him to do anything,” said Iyer.

Iyer's comments underline a crucial moment for Shaw, once seen as a rising star in cricket, as he needs to rediscover his form and regain his place in the national team.
newTitle: 'Can't Babysit Anyone': Shreyas Iyer's Call to Prithvi Shaw to Improve Work Ethic

title: Rohan Jaitley re-elected as DDCA president, defeats TMC's Kirti Azad - Hindustan Times
summary:
Rohan Jaitley Re-elected as DDCA President, Defeats Kirti Azad

Published on: Dec 17, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Rohan Jaitley has been re-elected as the president of the Delhi District Cricket Association (DDCA) after winning a closely contested election against Kirti Azad.

  • Jaitley secured 1,577 votes while Azad received 777 votes.
  • A total of 2,413 votes were cast, with 1,207 needed to win.
  • Jaitley’s group won all other executive posts as well, including Shikha Kumar as vice president.
  • Azad, a former cricketer and current TMC MP, alleged corruption in DDCA during his campaign.
  • Rohan is the son of Arun Jaitley, who previously served as DDCA president for 14 years.
“The city’s cricket body spent only a fraction of the ₹140 crore it got from BCCI last year.” - Kirti Azad

This re-election continues Jaitley’s leadership in a critical period for cricket administration in Delhi.
newTitle: Rohan Jaitley Re-elected as DDCA President, Defeats Kirti Azad

India's chances of leading in the 2024-25 Border-Gavaskar Trophy are at risk as rain threatens to interrupt play at the Gabba. After 33.1 overs, Australia dominated Day 3, leaving India in a tough spot with 51/4.

  • India struggled on Day 3, losing four top-order batsmen quickly.
  • Rain may favor India by keeping a draw as a viable outcome.

title: England seize control in new-ball onslaught as South Africa collapse - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
England seize control in new-ball onslaught as South Africa collapse

Publication Date: Not specified Source: ESPN Cricinfo

England declared their innings at 395 for 9 and took a lead of 145 runs against South Africa, who were bowled out for 281.

  • Laura Wolvaardt, Marizanne Kapp, and Sune Luus each scored half-centuries but couldn't convert them into three figures.
  • Lauren Bell achieved career-best bowling figures of 4 for 49, contributing to South Africa's collapse.
  • South Africa lost 7 wickets for just 44 runs, tarnishing their good starts earlier in the match.
  • Partnerships of 92 and a record 99 runs for the fourth wicket were not enough to stabilize the innings.
  • England's seamers were particularly effective, well managed by captain Heather Knight.
“South Africa could have benefitted from a referral. Kapp was convinced she had Tammy Beaumont out but was given not out.”

In conclusion, England has firmly taken control of the match, leaving South Africa in a precarious position as they look to salvage their innings in the face of a significant deficit.
newTitle: England Take Charge as South Africa Falters in Test Match

Uttar Pradesh fast bowler Ankit Rajpoot has announced his retirement from Indian cricket after a notable career.

  • In his retirement announcement, Rajpoot expressed gratitude for the support he received throughout his journey.
  • He plans to explore new opportunities in cricket and its business side.
“Today, with immense gratitude & humility, I announce my retirement from Indian Cricket. My journey from 2009-2024 has been the most wonderful period of my life.”

Rajpoot's legacy in Indian cricket is marked by his impressive statistics and the respect he garnered within the sport.

summary:

Publication Date: November 7, 2024 | Source: The Sun

Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim is questioning two players over the recent leaks of starting lineups on social media, amidst concerns that opposition teams can benefit from this information.

  • Amorim is addressing the leak issue following a recent derby victory against Manchester City.
  • Players Amad Diallo and Alejandro Garnacho have been questioned regarding their involvement in the leaks.

title: Anil Kumble breaks silence after fake quotes on Virat Kohli's form, Rohit Sharma's captaincy spark social media outrage - Hindustan Times
summary:
Anil Kumble Addresses Fake Quotes on Social Media Regarding Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Former Indian cricket captain Anil Kumble has issued a statement condemning the circulation of fake quotes attributed to him concerning Virat Kohli's performance and Rohit Sharma's captaincy, amidst the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Kumble clarified that these quotes do not reflect his opinions.
  • The misinformation has led to social media outrage.
  • Kumble urged fans to verify information before sharing it.
  • Sunil Gavaskar faced a similar issue recently, with fake news targeting him.
“It has come to my attention that some social media accounts are using my image and attributing fabricated quotes to me. I want to categorically deny any association with these accounts and their content.”

Kumble's statement highlights the growing issue of fake news in the cricketing community, urging vigilance among fans.

title: World Chess Championship: Chennai comes out in big numbers to welcome its newest hero Gukesh - The Indian Express
summary:
World Chess Championship: Chennai comes out in big numbers to welcome its newest hero Gukesh

Date: December 16, 2024 Source: Indian Express

Chennai erupted in celebration as D. Gukesh returned after being crowned the youngest world chess champion. The reception was marked by fans, students, and media frenzy at the airport.

  • Gukesh wore his winner's medal and held the championship trophy upon his arrival.
  • His homecoming included a guard of honour from students of his alma mater.
  • An overwhelming crowd of supporters created chaos at the airport.
  • The Sports Development Authority of Tamil Nadu played a crucial role in his journey to becoming champion.
“My dream was to become the youngest world champion. I am very happy to achieve this goal and come home,” Gukesh said.

Despite the celebrations, Gukesh remains humble and focused on further improvement.

title: 'Virat Kohli brought this upon himself...': Gavaskar admits 'worrying' signs over India great's repetitive dismissals - Hindustan Times
summary:
Gavaskar Expresses Concern Over Kohli's Repetitive Dismissals

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Virat Kohli continues to struggle with wide deliveries in Test cricket, facing criticism for his dismissals. Experts like Sunil Gavaskar comment on his need for greater discipline at the crease.

  • Kohli was dismissed for just 3 runs in the first innings of the Brisbane Test.
  • His dismissal came while chasing a wide delivery from Josh Hazlewood, leading to India being 22/3.
  • Gavaskar criticizes Kohli's eagerness to chase deliveries outside the off-stump.
  • He advises Kohli to take his time and not play aggressively too early in his innings.
  • Kohli scored a century in the first Test but has struggled in subsequent innings.
“In the earlier three dismissals, there was nothing wrong. (But) this one, he brought this upon himself because he could've left that ball well alone.” - Sunil Gavaskar

The ongoing struggles of Virat Kohli raise concerns about his form and adaptability against quality seam bowling.
newTitle: Gavaskar Expresses Concern Over Kohli's Repetitive Dismissals

title: Gillespie: I was 'completely and utterly blindsided' by the PCB - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Gillespie Resigns as Pakistan's Head Coach, Citing Lack of Communication

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Jason Gillespie, the former Australia cricketer, stepped down from his position as Pakistan's Test cricket head coach, stating he was 'completely and utterly blindsided' by the Pakistan Cricket Board's decisions regarding his role.

Gillespie's contract was set to expire in 2026, but he resigned due to frustrations over inadequate communication from the PCB, especially concerning the non-renewal of high-performance coach Tim Nielsen.

  • Gillespie expressed his surprise and disappointment at being uninformed about critical decisions affecting his coaching role.
  • The lack of a clear communication structure contributed to his feeling of uncertainty regarding his future with the team.
  • Despite previous positive feedback regarding team performance, Gillespie felt his authority and role were undermined.
“You want to be able to have clear communication with all stakeholders... knowing what the team is as head coach well before the game.” - Jason Gillespie

In conclusion, Gillespie's departure reflects ongoing issues within the Pakistan Cricket Board regarding coaching staff and communication, as interim coach Aaqib Javed steps in.
newTitle: Gillespie Resigns as Pakistan's Head Coach, Citing Lack of Communication

title: Hayden's ‘brotherly’ advice for struggling Rohit Sharma with two ‘trigger words’: 'I'd be saying to him as his partner…' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Hayden's Key Advice to Rohit Sharma: Focus on Intent and Energy

Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Legendary Australian cricketer Matthew Hayden has shared crucial advice aimed at helping Indian captain Rohit Sharma regain his batting form. Hayden emphasizes the need for Rohit to bring back his positive intent and energy in his game, especially after a recent struggle with form in red-ball cricket.

  • Rohit has struggled recently, averaging just 11.83 in his last 12 innings.
  • He has sacrificed his opening position for KL Rahul in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Hayden suggests that Rohit needs to focus on being reactive rather than defensive.
  • He mentions that 'intent' and 'energy' are key 'trigger words' for Rohit.
"When I think of Rohit Sharma, I think of a free-scoring batsman... For purely Rohit Sharma's sake, he needs to have a great intent and energy about him." - Matthew Hayden

In conclusion, Hayden believes that by focusing on intent and energy, Rohit can regain his batting rhythm and confidence, which will ultimately benefit the team.
newTitle: Hayden's Key Advice to Rohit Sharma: Focus on Intent and Energy

title: 'Can't have mindset of pointing fingers at each other': Jasprit Bumrah - The Times of India
summary:
'Can't have mindset of pointing fingers at each other': Jasprit Bumrah

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

India's vice-captain Jasprit Bumrah emphasized that the team should not blame each other during their transition phase, despite a disappointing performance in the Brisbane Test.

  • Bumrah has taken 18 wickets in the ongoing Border Gavaskar Trophy.
  • India is currently level in the series against Australia at 1-1.
  • The team struggled in their batting response, collapsing to 51 for 4 against Australia's first-innings total of 445.
  • Bumrah supports his fellow bowlers and focuses on teamwork.
  • He acknowledges the team's inexperience compared to past tours.
"We don't want to get into that mindset where we're pointing fingers at each other," stated Bumrah. "As a bowling unit, we are in transition. So it's my job to help others. I have played a little more than them, so I am trying to help them."

The Indian team aims to build partnerships as they continue their fight on the field amidst challenging conditions.
newTitle: 'Can't have mindset of pointing fingers at each other': Jasprit Bumrah

title: 'Not made for the new ball': Ex-India cricketer questions Virat Kohli's technique - The Times of India
summary:
Ex-India Cricketer Questions Virat Kohli's Technique Against New Ball

Date: Monday

Source: Times of India

Former India cricketer Cheteshwar Pujara has raised concerns regarding Virat Kohli's technique against the new ball during the ongoing Gabba Test, asserting that his approach may not adequately address the challenges of facing fresh, moving deliveries.

  • Pujara highlights Kohli's struggle against the new ball, having been dismissed during crucial moments.
  • Kohli scored a century against the old ball but has struggled significantly, with only 26 runs in the remaining innings.
  • Pujara suggests that Kohli needs a mental shift rather than just technical adjustments to improve his performance.
  • All of Kohli's dismissals this series have come from catches to slip or wicketkeeper, pointing to issues in execution and mindset.
“His technique is not made for the new ball... If he plays the new ball, the bowlers are fresh, and their confidence is also high.” - Cheteshwar Pujara

Pujara expresses that Kohli's struggles reflect a need for mental adjustments in addition to his practice, as he has failed to apply learned techniques during matches.
newTitle: Ex-India Cricketer Questions Virat Kohli's Technique Against New Ball

title: Time to 'point fingers' as India's batting self-destructs again, reckless shots doom another disappointing collapse - Hindustan Times
summary:
Time to 'point fingers' as India's batting self-destructs again, reckless shots doom another disappointing collapse

Publication Date: December 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

India's batting line-up once again faced collapse against Australia, with reckless shot selection leading to disappointing totals and creating a hole in the Test match on the third day.

  • India was bowled out for 150 in Perth and 180 in Adelaide, putting them at a severe disadvantage.
  • Jasprit Bumrah excelled with the ball, but the batting failures overshadowed his performance.
  • Shubman Gill and Virat Kohli's dismissals raised questions about their shot selection and discipline.
  • Australia's bowlers, including Mitchell Starc and Josh Hazlewood, exploited India's weaknesses, leading to a deteriorating batting display.
“We don't, as a team, point fingers at each other... maybe you should start pointing fingers.” - Jasprit Bumrah

This ongoing batting crisis indicates a lack of strategy and discipline in India's approach, which could have lasting implications for their performance in this series.
newTitle: India's Batting Collapse Dooms Test Match Against Australia
